trans-unit.source: Composition effects
trans-unit.target: Composition effects

trans-unit.source: The effect APIs enable developers to customize how their UI is rendered.
trans-unit.target: The effect APIs enable developers to customize how their UI is rendered.

trans-unit.source: Composition effects
trans-unit.target: Composition effects

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.UI.Composition**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706878) WinRT API allows Real-time effects to be applied to images and UI with animatable effect properties.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.UI.Composition**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn706878) WinRT API allows Real-time effects to be applied to images and UI with animatable effect properties.

trans-unit.source: In this overview, we’ll run through the functionality available that allows effects to be applied to a composition visual.
trans-unit.target: In this overview, we’ll run through the functionality available that allows effects to be applied to a composition visual.

trans-unit.source: To support [Universal Windows Platform (UWP)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn726767.aspx) consistency for developers describing effects in their applications, composition effects leverage Win2D’s IGraphicsEffect interface to use effect descriptions via the [Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects](http://microsoft.github.io/Win2D/html/N_Microsoft_Graphics_Canvas_Effects.md) Namespace.
trans-unit.target: To support [Universal Windows Platform (UWP)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn726767.aspx) consistency for developers describing effects in their applications, composition effects leverage Win2D’s IGraphicsEffect interface to use effect descriptions via the [Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects](http://microsoft.github.io/Win2D/html/N_Microsoft_Graphics_Canvas_Effects.md) Namespace.

trans-unit.source: Brush effects are used to paint areas of an application by applying effects to a set of existing images.
trans-unit.target: Brush effects are used to paint areas of an application by applying effects to a set of existing images.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 composition effect APIs are focused on Sprite Visuals.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 composition effect APIs are focused on Sprite Visuals.

trans-unit.source: The SpriteVisual allows for flexibility and interplay in color, image and effect creation.
trans-unit.target: The SpriteVisual allows for flexibility and interplay in color, image and effect creation.

trans-unit.source: The SpriteVisual is a composition visual type that can fill a 2D rectangle with a brush.
trans-unit.target: The SpriteVisual is a composition visual type that can fill a 2D rectangle with a brush.

trans-unit.source: The visual defines the bounds of the rectangle and the brush defines the pixels used to paint the rectangle.
trans-unit.target: The visual defines the bounds of the rectangle and the brush defines the pixels used to paint the rectangle.

trans-unit.source: Effect brushes are used on composition tree visuals whose content comes from the output of an effect graph.
trans-unit.target: Effect brushes are used on composition tree visuals whose content comes from the output of an effect graph.

trans-unit.source: Effects can reference existing surfaces/textures, but not the output of other composition trees.
trans-unit.target: Effects can reference existing surfaces/textures, but not the output of other composition trees.

trans-unit.target: Effect Features

trans-unit.target: Effect Library

trans-unit.source: Effect Library
trans-unit.target: Effect Library

trans-unit.source: Currently composition supports the following effects:
trans-unit.target: Currently composition supports the following effects:

trans-unit.source: Effect
trans-unit.target: Effect

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: 2D affine transform
trans-unit.target: 2D affine transform

trans-unit.source: Applies a 2D affine transform matrix to an image.
trans-unit.target: Applies a 2D affine transform matrix to an image.

trans-unit.source: We used this effect to animate alpha mask in our effect [samples](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10240_WIN10_RTM/BasicCompositonEffects).
trans-unit.target: We used this effect to animate alpha mask in our effect [samples](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10240_WIN10_RTM/BasicCompositonEffects).

trans-unit.source: Arithmetic composite
trans-unit.target: Arithmetic composite

trans-unit.source: Combines two images using a flexible equation.
trans-unit.target: Combines two images using a flexible equation.

trans-unit.source: We used arithmetic composite to create a crossfade effect in our [samples](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10240_WIN10_RTM/BasicCompositonEffects).
trans-unit.target: We used arithmetic composite to create a crossfade effect in our [samples](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10240_WIN10_RTM/BasicCompositonEffects).

trans-unit.source: Blend effect
trans-unit.target: Blend effect

trans-unit.source: Creates a blend effect that combines two images.
trans-unit.target: Creates a blend effect that combines two images.

trans-unit.source: Composition provides 21 of the 26 [blend modes](http://microsoft.github.io/Win2D/html/T_Microsoft_Graphics_Canvas_Effects_BlendEffectMode.md) supported in Win2D.
trans-unit.target: Composition provides 21 of the 26 [blend modes](http://microsoft.github.io/Win2D/html/T_Microsoft_Graphics_Canvas_Effects_BlendEffectMode.md) supported in Win2D.

trans-unit.source: Color source
trans-unit.target: Color source

trans-unit.source: Generates an image containing a solid color.
trans-unit.target: Generates an image containing a solid color.

trans-unit.source: Composite
trans-unit.target: Composite

trans-unit.source: Combines two images.
trans-unit.target: Combines two images.

trans-unit.source: Composition provides all 13 [composite modes](http://microsoft.github.io/Win2D/html/T_Microsoft_Graphics_Canvas_CanvasComposite.md) supported in Win2D.
trans-unit.target: Composition provides all 13 [composite modes](http://microsoft.github.io/Win2D/html/T_Microsoft_Graphics_Canvas_CanvasComposite.md) supported in Win2D.

trans-unit.source: Contrast
trans-unit.target: Contrast

trans-unit.source: Increases or decreases the contrast of an image.
trans-unit.target: Increases or decreases the contrast of an image.

trans-unit.source: Exposure
trans-unit.target: Exposure

trans-unit.source: Increases or decreases the exposure of an image.
trans-unit.target: Increases or decreases the exposure of an image.

trans-unit.source: Grayscale
trans-unit.target: Grayscale

trans-unit.source: Converts an image to monochromatic gray.
trans-unit.target: Converts an image to monochromatic gray.

trans-unit.source: Gamma transfer
trans-unit.target: Gamma transfer

trans-unit.source: Alters the colors of an image by applying a per-channel gamma transfer function.
trans-unit.target: Alters the colors of an image by applying a per-channel gamma transfer function.

trans-unit.source: Hue rotate
trans-unit.target: Hue rotate

trans-unit.source: Alters the color of an image by rotating its hue values.
trans-unit.target: Alters the color of an image by rotating its hue values.

trans-unit.source: Invert
trans-unit.target: Invert

trans-unit.source: Inverts the colors of an image.
trans-unit.target: Inverts the colors of an image.

trans-unit.source: Saturate
trans-unit.target: Saturate

trans-unit.source: Alters the saturation of an image.
trans-unit.target: Alters the saturation of an image.

trans-unit.source: Sepia
trans-unit.target: Sepia

trans-unit.source: Converts an image to sepia tones.
trans-unit.target: Converts an image to sepia tones.

trans-unit.source: Temperature and tint
trans-unit.target: Temperature and tint

trans-unit.source: Adjusts the temperature and/or tint of an image.
trans-unit.target: Adjusts the temperature and/or tint of an image.

trans-unit.source: See Win2D’s [Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects](http://microsoft.github.io/Win2D/html/N_Microsoft_Graphics_Canvas_Effects.md) Namespace for more detailed information.
trans-unit.target: See Win2D’s [Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects](http://microsoft.github.io/Win2D/html/N_Microsoft_Graphics_Canvas_Effects.md) Namespace for more detailed information.

trans-unit.source: Effects not supported in composition are noted as \[NoComposition\].
trans-unit.target: Effects not supported in composition are noted as \[NoComposition\].

trans-unit.source: Chaining Effects
trans-unit.target: Chaining Effects

trans-unit.source: Effects can be chained, allowing an application to simultaneously use multiple effects on an image.
trans-unit.target: Effects can be chained, allowing an application to simultaneously use multiple effects on an image.

trans-unit.source: Effect graphs can support multiple effects that can refer to one and other.
trans-unit.target: Effect graphs can support multiple effects that can refer to one and other.

trans-unit.source: When describing your effect, simply add an effect as input to your effect.
trans-unit.target: When describing your effect, simply add an effect as input to your effect.

trans-unit.source: The example above describes an arithmetic composite effect which has two inputs.
trans-unit.target: The example above describes an arithmetic composite effect which has two inputs.

trans-unit.source: The second input has a saturation effect with a .5 saturation property.
trans-unit.target: The second input has a saturation effect with a .5 saturation property.

trans-unit.source: Animation Support
trans-unit.target: Animation Support

trans-unit.source: Effect properties support animation, during effect compilation you can specify effect properties can be animated and which can be "baked in" as constants.
trans-unit.target: Effect properties support animation, during effect compilation you can specify effect properties can be animated and which can be "baked in" as constants.

trans-unit.source: The animatable properties are specified through strings of the form “effect name.property name”.
trans-unit.target: The animatable properties are specified through strings of the form “effect name.property name”.

trans-unit.source: These properties can be animated independently over multiple instantiations of the effect.
trans-unit.target: These properties can be animated independently over multiple instantiations of the effect.

trans-unit.source: Effect properties – Constant vs Animated
trans-unit.target: Effect properties – Constant vs Animated

trans-unit.source: During effect compilation you can specify effect properties as dynamic or as properties that are "baked in" as constants.
trans-unit.target: During effect compilation you can specify effect properties as dynamic or as properties that are "baked in" as constants.

trans-unit.source: The dynamic properties are specified through strings of the form “<effect name>.<property name>”.
trans-unit.target: The dynamic properties are specified through strings of the form “<effect name>.<property name>”.

trans-unit.source: The dynamic properties can be set to a specific value or can be animated using the composition animation system.
trans-unit.target: The dynamic properties can be set to a specific value or can be animated using the composition animation system.

trans-unit.source: When compiling the effect description above, you have the flexibility of either baking in saturation to be equal to 0.5 or making it dynamic and setting it dynamically or animating it.
trans-unit.target: When compiling the effect description above, you have the flexibility of either baking in saturation to be equal to 0.5 or making it dynamic and setting it dynamically or animating it.

trans-unit.source: Compiling an effect with saturation baked in:
trans-unit.target: Compiling an effect with saturation baked in:

trans-unit.source: Compiling an effect with dynamic saturation:
trans-unit.target: Compiling an effect with dynamic saturation:

trans-unit.source: The saturation property of the effect above can then be either set to a static value or animated using either Expression or ScalarKeyFrame animations.
trans-unit.target: The saturation property of the effect above can then be either set to a static value or animated using either Expression or ScalarKeyFrame animations.

trans-unit.source: You can create a ScalarKeyFrame that will be used to animate the Saturation property of an effect like this:
trans-unit.target: You can create a ScalarKeyFrame that will be used to animate the Saturation property of an effect like this:

trans-unit.source: Start the animation on the Saturation property of the effect like this:
trans-unit.target: Start the animation on the Saturation property of the effect like this:

trans-unit.source: See the [Desaturation - Animation sample](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10586_NOV_UPDATE_RTM/BasicCompositonEffects/Desaturation%20-%20Animation) for effect properties animated with key frames and the [AlphaMask sample](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10586_NOV_UPDATE_RTM/BasicCompositonEffects/AlphaMask) for use of effects and expressions.
trans-unit.target: See the [Desaturation - Animation sample](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10586_NOV_UPDATE_RTM/BasicCompositonEffects/Desaturation%20-%20Animation) for effect properties animated with key frames and the [AlphaMask sample](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10586_NOV_UPDATE_RTM/BasicCompositonEffects/AlphaMask) for use of effects and expressions.

trans-unit.source: Multiple Effect Instances with Independent Properties
trans-unit.target: Multiple Effect Instances with Independent Properties

trans-unit.source: By specifying that a parameter should be dynamic during effect compilation, the parameter can then be changed on a per-effect instance basis.
trans-unit.target: By specifying that a parameter should be dynamic during effect compilation, the parameter can then be changed on a per-effect instance basis.

trans-unit.source: This allows two Visuals to use the same effect but be rendered with different effect properties.
trans-unit.target: This allows two Visuals to use the same effect but be rendered with different effect properties.

trans-unit.source: See the ColorSource and Blend [sample](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10586_NOV_UPDATE_RTM/BasicCompositonEffects/ColorSource%20and%20Blend) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See the ColorSource and Blend [sample](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10586_NOV_UPDATE_RTM/BasicCompositonEffects/ColorSource%20and%20Blend) for more information.

trans-unit.source: Getting Started with Composition Effects
trans-unit.target: Getting Started with Composition Effects

trans-unit.source: This quick start tutorial shows you how to make use of some of the basic capabilities of effects.
trans-unit.target: This quick start tutorial shows you how to make use of some of the basic capabilities of effects.

trans-unit.source: Installing Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Installing Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: If you don't have a supported version of Visual Studio installed, go to the Visual Studio Downloads page [here](https://www.visualstudio.com/downloads/download-visual-studio-vs.aspx).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have a supported version of Visual Studio installed, go to the Visual Studio Downloads page [here](https://www.visualstudio.com/downloads/download-visual-studio-vs.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Creating a new project
trans-unit.target: Creating a new project

trans-unit.source: Go to File->New->Project...
trans-unit.target: Go to File->New->Project...

trans-unit.source: Select 'Visual C#'
trans-unit.target: Select 'Visual C#'

trans-unit.source: Create a 'Blank App (Windows Universal)' (Visual Studio 2015)
trans-unit.target: Create a 'Blank App (Windows Universal)' (Visual Studio 2015)

trans-unit.source: Enter a project name of your choosing
trans-unit.target: Enter a project name of your choosing

trans-unit.source: Click 'OK'
trans-unit.target: Click 'OK'

trans-unit.source: Installing Win2D
trans-unit.target: Installing Win2D

trans-unit.source: Win2D is released as a Nuget.org package and needs to be installed before you can use effects.
trans-unit.target: Win2D is released as a Nuget.org package and needs to be installed before you can use effects.

trans-unit.source: There are two package versions, one for Windows 10 and one for Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: There are two package versions, one for Windows 10 and one for Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: For Composition effects you’ll use the Windows 10 version.
trans-unit.target: For Composition effects you’ll use the Windows 10 version.

trans-unit.source: Launch the NuGet Package Manager by going to Tools → NuGet Package Manager → Manage NuGet Packages for Solution.
trans-unit.target: Launch the NuGet Package Manager by going to Tools → NuGet Package Manager → Manage NuGet Packages for Solution.

trans-unit.source: Search for "Win2D" and select the appropriate package for your target version of Windows.
trans-unit.target: Search for "Win2D" and select the appropriate package for your target version of Windows.

trans-unit.source: Because Windows.UI.
trans-unit.target: Because Windows.UI.

trans-unit.source: Composition supports Windows 10 (not 8.1), select Win2D.uwp.
trans-unit.target: Composition supports Windows 10 (not 8.1), select Win2D.uwp.

trans-unit.source: Accept the license agreement
trans-unit.target: Accept the license agreement

trans-unit.source: Click 'Close'
trans-unit.target: Click 'Close'

trans-unit.source: In the next few steps we will use composition API’s to apply a saturation effect to this cat image which will remove all saturation.
trans-unit.target: In the next few steps we will use composition API’s to apply a saturation effect to this cat image which will remove all saturation.

trans-unit.source: In this model the effect is created and then applied to an image.
trans-unit.target: In this model the effect is created and then applied to an image.

trans-unit.source: See the [Composition Visual Tree Sample](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10586_NOV_UPDATE_RTM/CompositionVisual) on our GitHub for an example of how to set up Windows.UI.Composition Compositor, root ContainerVisual, and associate with the Core Window.
trans-unit.target: See the [Composition Visual Tree Sample](https://github.com/Microsoft/composition/tree/master/SDK10586_NOV_UPDATE_RTM/CompositionVisual) on our GitHub for an example of how to set up Windows.UI.Composition Compositor, root ContainerVisual, and associate with the Core Window.

trans-unit.target: Creating a CompositionSurface Brush

trans-unit.source: Creating, Compiling and Applying Effects
trans-unit.target: Creating, Compiling and Applying Effects

trans-unit.source: 1.) Create the graphics effect
trans-unit.target: 1.) Create the graphics effect

trans-unit.source: 2.) Compile the effect and create effect brush
trans-unit.target: 2.) Compile the effect and create effect brush

trans-unit.source: 3.) Create a SpriteVIsual in the composition tree and apply the effect
trans-unit.target: 3.) Create a SpriteVIsual in the composition tree and apply the effect

trans-unit.source: 4.) Create your image source to load.
trans-unit.target: 4.) Create your image source to load.

trans-unit.source: 5.) Size and brush the surface on the SpriteVisual
trans-unit.target: 5.) Size and brush the surface on the SpriteVisual

trans-unit.source: 6.) Run your app – your results should be a desaturated cat:
trans-unit.target: 6.) Run your app – your results should be a desaturated cat:

trans-unit.target: Desaturated image
